newsitem.title: POLAND: POLAND TO EXCHANGE PSU INTO SHARES MAY 12.
newsitem.headline: POLAND TO EXCHANGE PSU INTO SHARES MAY 12.

text.p: Poland is likely to start exchanging participation certificates in its mass privatisation scheme (PSU) into shares in the National Investment Funds from May 12 until the end of 1998, a deputy treasury minister said.
Ewa Freyberg told Reuters the final decision on the starting the exchange would be taken by the securities commission, most likely later on Thursday.
"According to our schedule the starting date for exchanging the PSU certificates into shares in the funds is May 12. But this will primarily depend on the the Securities Commission," Freyberg said.

Under the mass privatisaiotn programme each of the 26 million adult Poles who bought the certificates last year will be able to exchange it for a total of 15 shares of the National Investment Funds (NFI) -- one share in each fund.
The funds, privately managed by Polish-foreign consortia, together run more than 500 companies which took part in the privatisation programme.
The PSU certificates are traded on the Warsaw bourse and so will shares in the NFIs.
